The elections in Iraq haven't even started yet, but the election fraud is well on its way. The Iraqi government has learned quite well from their neo-con masters how to rig an election.
 
 And naturally its the Sunnis who are getting the shaft. The Iraqi government has decided that to reject the constitution a 2/3 majority of all registered voters in three provinces instead of actual voters is needed. Nice little ploy here to get the constitution ratified since the actual turnout will probably not even reach 66%.
 
 Makes me wonder if the Iraqi government is out to start an all out civil war...
 
 http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/4306094.stm
